channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 从艺术角度看，这部电视剧存在缺陷。但是，从专制的角度来看，它却恰到好处--最重要的是，它捕捉到了这种权力本身就是一种扭曲的表演：
item.description:
Artistically, the TV show has flaws. But, autocratically, it hits the mark—above all in capturing the way this sort of power is itself a kind of twisted performance: https://t.co/KgaJdPW8CY pic.twitter.com/p8pTY2kcTF

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 2023 年，XL Bullies 在英国狗类数量中的占比不到 1%，但根据英国恶霸观察组织（Bully Watch UK）的数据，这种狗要对 44% 的狗对人的攻击负责。是什么让这种特殊的犬种如此危险？ 👇
item.description:
In 2023 XL Bullies made up less than 1% of Britain’s dog population and yet, according to Bully Watch UK, the dogs were responsible for 44% of dog attacks on people.

What makes this particular breed so dangerous? https://t.co/PDmLzMrNcq 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 近年来，保守党大臣们一直在对英国宪法进行核物理实验。当一个更强大的国家落入反对党手中时，会发生什么？ 👇
item.description:
In recent years Conservative Party ministers have been conducting an experiment with the nuclear physics of the British constitution.

What happens when a more powerful state fall into the hands of the opposition? https://t.co/V1L8Wx6WJe 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 要让顾客、员工、投资者和分析师满意，可不是一件容易的事。那么，零售商的秘诀是什么呢？ 👇
item.description:
Keeping customers, employees, investors and analysts happy is no mean feat. So what is the retailer’s secret? https://t.co/42v2XK1STd 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 我们精选的最佳战争小说横跨世界各地的一系列冲突--从佛兰德斯的战壕到越南的丛林Ὅ。
item.description:
Our selection of the best war novels spans a range of conflicts around the world—from the trenches of Flanders to the jungles of Vietnam https://t.co/ZsT2KGOPyN 📚

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 在尼日利亚开采石油近七十年的壳牌石油公司已同意出售其陆上子公司。其他石油公司也在收拾行囊。这使人们对尼日利亚最重要的产业感到焦虑。
item.description:
Shell, which has been pumping oil in Nigeria for nearly seven decades, has agreed to sell its onshore subsidiary. Other oil firms are packing up too.

This is giving rise to anxiety over the country’s most vital industry https://t.co/Lq6qcRjnJy 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 社会对我们狂轰滥炸，要求我们变得更快乐、更健康、更富有。为什么我们变得如此不满足于平凡？ 👇
item.description:
Society bombards us with instructions to be happier, fitter and richer. Why have we become so dissatisfied with being ordinary? https://t.co/342tGF2Nqk 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 100 天之后，哈维尔-米莱伊就可以吹嘘自己取得了真正的经济成就。如果他能在明年年末的中期选举前保持公众的支持，他就能极大地增强自己的影响力，从而提高重塑阿根廷经济的能力 👇
item.description:
After 100 days Javier Milei can boast of real economic success. If he can keep the public onside until midterm elections late next year, he could dramatically bolster his influence and thereby his ability to remake Argentina’s economy https://t.co/vH0s5DktmA 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 当一家公司濒临绝境时，投资银行家、顾问和律师就会应运而生。对于这批人来说，今年将是利润丰厚的一年👇。
item.description:
When a company is on the edge of a precipice investment bankers are enlisted, consultants are drafted, and lawyers are brought in. For this lot this year is shaping up to be lucrative https://t.co/9Tp256okkE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 印度公司通过一个不透明的 "选举债券 "系统斥资数亿美元进行政治捐款。大部分资金都流向了纳伦德拉-莫迪的执政党👇。
item.description:
Indian companies have spent hundreds of millions of dollars on political donations via an opaque system of “electoral bonds”. Most of the funding has gone to Narendra Modi’s ruling party https://t.co/lYK2ktMlEO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 中国很久以前就禁止 Facebook 和 YouTube 等美国人拥有的社交媒体网站。但是，中国自己的版本已经发展成为广泛的媒体平台--北京的官员们也在关注👇。
item.description:
China long ago banned American-owned social-media sites such as Facebook and YouTube. But its own versions have evolved into broad media platforms—and officials in Beijing are paying attention https://t.co/gKOUzPgEEF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 恋爱关系中的最佳年龄差距是多少？我们研究了从离婚率到预期寿命的证据 👇
item.description:
What’s the best age gap in a relationship? We examine the evidence, from divorce rates to life expectancy https://t.co/z0SxM0bsYF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 即使对那些没有经济利益的人来说，市场也能为选票的经济利害关系提供一个残酷而坦率的视角。随着美国和英国以及许多其他国家的选举临近，这一点尤为宝贵👇。
item.description:
Even for those without a financial interest, markets offer a brutally frank perspective on the economic stakes of a ballot.

As elections approach in America and Britain, as well as plenty of other countries, that is especially valuable https://t.co/Fp4RLXFFZB 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: "不可能的怪物》回顾了改变人类思想的 70 年。书中详细介绍了恐龙化石的发现如何引发了一场革命👇。
item.description:
“Impossible Monsters” looks at 70 years that changed human thought. The book details how the discovery of dinosaur fossils caused a revolution https://t.co/gujMbaJods 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 为了制作具有 3D 图形效果的街机游戏，人们意外地改变了人工智能。请收听我们的 "巴贝奇 "播客，与 @alokjha 和 @tomstandage 🎧 一探究竟。
item.description:
The quest to build arcade games with 3D graphics accidentally transformed AI. Listen to our “Babbage” podcast to find out how, with @alokjha and @tomstandage https://t.co/AzlFVf51zQ 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 只是没有那么充实 👇
item.description:
It is just not that fulfilling https://t.co/xnN4t67OGx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 在美国，大多数人认为上大学不值得。对于普通本科生来说，事实远非如此--但对于数量惊人的学生来说，回报确实微不足道 👇
item.description:
In America a majority of people think going to university is not worth it. For the average undergraduate that is far from the truth—but for a shocking number of students, the returns are indeed puny https://t.co/IMFM9AO50d 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 横向调动，从事不涉及升职甚至不一定加薪的工作，对员工和组织来说都是一种福音 🦀
item.description:
Sideways moves, to jobs that don’t involve a promotion or even necessarily a pay rise, can be a boon to employees and organisations alike https://t.co/HeL6chOWb1 🦀

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 根据一家房地产咨询公司的数据，阿尔迪南美每年在美国开设约 100 家店铺，比任何其他零售商都快，包括 Lidl（年轻的竞争对手）和 Aldi Nord（拥有 Trader Joe's 超市，但不在美国经营阿尔迪店铺）👇。
item.description:
According to a property consultancy, Aldi Süd has been opening around 100 shops a year in America, faster than any other retailer—including Lidl (a younger rival), and Aldi Nord (which owns Trader Joe’s supermarkets but does not run Aldi shops there) https://t.co/oW2jg5WJHL 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: "詹姆斯-贝内特（James Bennet）写道："美国人可以尽情嚷嚷他们缺乏言论自由，但如果他们不学会重新倾听彼此的声音，他们将永远无法克服分歧，也无法解决任何真正的问题。
item.description:
“Americans can shout about their lack of free speech all they want, but they will never be able to overcome their differences, and deal with any of their real problems, if they do not learn to listen to each other again,” writes James Bennet https://t.co/Dp5KgI67tc 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 我们的姊妹公司 EIU 自 2006 年以来一直在追踪美国的民主衰落。这些图表显示了美国的不足之处 👇
item.description:
Our sister company, EIU, has tracked America’s democratic decline since 2006. These charts show where the country is falling short https://t.co/vsZ0sidFdS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 一位西方外交官说，这么多敌对势力在吉布提近在咫尺，感觉 "就像昆汀-塔伦蒂诺（Quentin Tarantino）的对峙，他们都用枪指着对方"。
item.description:
The proximity of so many rival powers in Djibouti feels “like a Quentin Tarantino stand-off with them all pointing guns at each other”, one Western diplomat says.

Liam Taylor reports on the fallout from the Houthis’ attacks on global shipping https://t.co/hZfpUAA9rm

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 研究人员使用人工智能模型预测哪位足球运动员会在角球开出后首先触球，准确率与人类专家相似。
item.description:
Researchers used an AI model to predict which footballer would wind up making first contact with the ball after a corner kick, with similar accuracy to human experts.

Coaches should be pacing in front of their dugouts in excitement https://t.co/R7X8e6g5OC ⚽

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 自 10 月份以来，亚洲和欧洲之间的集装箱航运成本飙升了近 300%，原因是船只为了避开胡塞武装的袭击而选择了长途航线。现在，他们也需要绕道索马里了 👇。
item.description:
The cost of shipping containers between Asia and Europe has surged by almost 300% since October, as ships take the long route to avoid Houthi attacks. Now they will need to give Somalia a wide berth, too https://t.co/u7O7FddBGM 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 注意到本周的《经济学人》有些不同了吗？以下是我们改变字体的原因和方法 👇
item.description:
Notice something different about your edition of The Economist this week? Here’s why—and how—we’ve changed our font https://t.co/KUZaZNOJTF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: "解决之道就是让 Etsy 变得更 Etsy"。@jgsilverman 在 "Money Talks "节目中告诉 @alice_fulwood 电子商务巨头如何应对 Temu 为赢得美国购物者的青睐而做出的努力🎧。
item.description:
“The solution is for Etsy to be even more Etsy.” @jgsilverman tells @alice_fulwood how the e-commerce giant is responding to Temu’s bid to win over American shoppers, on “Money Talks” https://t.co/xTJBQ68kww 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 令人惊讶的是，美国堕胎总数增长的很大一部分是支持性州居民堕胎数量增加的结果。这种增长至少在某种程度上可能是这些州努力改善堕胎机会的结果👇。
item.description:
A surprisingly large part of America’s total growth in abortions is the result of increases among residents of supportive states.

This growth is likely to be, at least to some extent, the result of efforts to improve access in such states https://t.co/xVls41kST8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: "一位专家警告说："俄罗斯和乌克兰的网络战争正变得比以往任何时候都更具侵略性，未来还将继续扩大，可能会对关键......目标造成更大的破坏。但到目前为止还没有人获胜 👇
item.description:
“The Russia-Ukraine cyber war is becoming more aggressive than ever and will continue to expand in the future to potentially more devastating critical…targets,” warns an expert. But so far no one is winning https://t.co/H16AaNZaEh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 这位前总统的新政党可能会使南非即将举行的选举成为种族隔离制度结束以来影响最大的一次选举。
item.description:
The former president’s new party could help make South Africa’s upcoming election the most consequential since the end of apartheid https://t.co/8TheqBdNRL

Photo: Reuters pic.twitter.com/e2kEBnargt

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰需要的盟友必须是大手笔、大军费，并果断地站在自己一边。目前的情况是，欧洲国家要么太小而不重要，要么太穷而帮不上忙，要么太犹豫而不愿意使用自己的力量--如果不是三者兼而有之的话👇。
item.description:
Ukraine needs allies that are hefty, big military spenders and decisively on its side. As things stand, European countries are either too small to matter, too broke to help or too hesitant to use their power—if not all three https://t.co/ADQ5neUTlI 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024
